intro: Dorstenia ellenbeckiana, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's false arum, is a rare and striking member of the Moraceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its unique, spirally twisted leaves and a distinctive inflorescence that resembles a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after by botanists and horticulturists.
